instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED..
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL is another way to say SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL, look at the definition provided for SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL as it applies to .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no accu to "see"
threads.message:
hello group I just repaired that machine with gpu problem by replacing gpu


now the accu is not to "see" I dont know if it was already before repair.

accu is good, tryed in another machine and it is to see
machine is working with power and or with accu alone
no orange light

<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA</SIGNAL> with red to groud I get the same, about .473
both lines have 3.42V and on the oscilloscope is data to see.

what could here the problem? is it a good idea to replace <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no accu to "see"
threads.message:
First why did you not take this to Apple??????
What is PPBUS voltage? Does battery indicator flash when button pressed?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no accu to "see"
threads.message:
if you bring the board to apple, do you charge your client that?

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with accu is 12.48V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> without accu is 12.48V

pressed battery indicator is flashing

in ASD is "no battery available"


now I have the laptop on the table (screen on table) and i opened it, the battery falls out and hanging only still on the connector and :-) now its working

pressing battery indicator not flashing anymore, orange light is here and in asd shows a battery.

so i dont know what could be here the problem, i guess a connector pin. 

thanks for help.
